paragraphs.title: Tweeter Sentiment Analysis (Hate Speech Classification)
paragraphs.text:
%md
# Tweeter Sentiment Analysis (Hate Speech Classification)

1. Purpose
2. Data reference
3. Data description
4. Relevant application developments

msg.data:
Tweeter Sentiment Analysis (Hate Speech Classification)

  1. Purpose
  2. Data reference
  3. Data description
  4. Relevant application developments

paragraphs.text:
%md 
# Purpose
The porpuse of this project is to detect hate speech in tweets. A tweet is said to contain hate speech if it has a racist or sexist or any other type of vile discriminatory sentiment associated with it. So, the task is to classify tweets that contain any sort of type of hate message from other tweets. Formally, given a training sample of tweets and labels, where label '1' denotes the tweet is racist/sexist and label '0' denotes the tweet is not racist/sexist, the objective is to predict the labels on the test dataset.

msg.data:
Purpose

The porpuse of this project is to detect hate speech in tweets. A tweet is said to contain hate speech if it has a racist or sexist or any other type of vile discriminatory sentiment associated with it. So, the task is to classify tweets that contain any sort of type of hate message from other tweets. Formally, given a training sample of tweets and labels, where label ‘1’ denotes the tweet is racist/sexist and label ‘0’ denotes the tweet is not racist/sexist, the objective is to predict the labels on the test dataset.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Data reference
1. Collection of tweets was split in the ratio of 65:35 into training and testing data. Out of the testing data, 30% is public and the rest is private.
2. Project motivation and data sets were adquired from Analytics Vidhya website at https://datahack.analyticsvidhya.com/contest/practice-problem-twitter-sentiment-analysis/
3. Data will be formated using spark DataFrame and compressed into a csv file 
4. Data preprocessing conducted as follow:
      1. Data exploration: identifying variables such as predictors and target variables, continuous and categorical variables.
      2. Data wranggling: missing value and outliers treatment
      3. Build a prediction model: using available and relevant machine learning tools
      4. Feature engineering: by doing variable transformation, tokenazation, bag of words.

msg.data:
Data reference

  1. Collection of tweets was split in the ratio of 65:35 into training and testing data. Out of the testing data, 30% is public and the rest is private.
  2. Project motivation and data sets were adquired from Analytics Vidhya website at https://datahack.analyticsvidhya.com/contest/practice-problem-twitter-sentiment-analysis/
  3. Data will be formated using spark DataFrame and compressed into a csv file
  4. Data preprocessing conducted as follow:
    1. Data exploration: identifying variables such as predictors and target variables, continuous and categorical variables.
    2. Data wranggling: missing value and outliers treatment
    3. Build a prediction model: using available and relevant machine learning tools
    4. Feature engineering: by doing variable transformation, tokenazation, bag of words.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Data description
The data gathered from the website only contains three feature classes, id, lable(true or false) and tweet.

msg.data:
Data description

The data gathered from the website only contains three feature classes, id, lable(true or false) and tweet.

import org.apache.spark.sql.SQLContext

// Create a new sql context:
val sqlContext = new SQLContext(sc)

// Upload train.csv dataset:
val df = sqlContext.read
    .format("com.databricks.spark.csv")
    .option("header", "true") // Use first line of all files as header
    .option("inferSchema", "true") // Automatically infer data types
    .load("/Users/leonardoroman/Desktop/data_science_projects/Kaggle/tweeter_project/data_sets/train.csv") // Train data set

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Relevant application developments
To build an application that will extract tweets at real time using spark streaming and to filter out hate speech tweets, user name, time and date.Also the application may find posible links and similarities between users that write sort of tweets and to identify any trends towards a spefic group of people.

msg.data:
Relevant application developments

To build an application that will extract tweets at real time using spark streaming and to filter out hate speech tweets, user name, time and date.Also the application may find posible links and similarities between users that write sort of tweets and to identify any trends towards a spefic group of people.
